results.title: Design
results.creator_credit: Kit Laybourne, Mickey Lemle and Time-Life Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Media Probes”.
This film considers various aspects of design. Fashion designer Bill Blass shows how clothes make a statement about the people wearing them and a graphic designer and two production assistants point out the tricks of the trade. The final segment shows how a national motel chain set out to change its corporate logo and then rejected the new image. Hosted by Bill Blass, photographed by Ed Lynch and written by Tony Kahn and Brad Kesden.

results.title: Turtle beach
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallace, Matt Carroll, Coote and Carroll, Regency International Pictures and Village Roadshow Pictures
results.brief_description: Judith Wilkes (Greta Scacchi) is an ambitious journalist on the trail of a story every reporter dreams of - a refugee in crisis in Malaysia with international repercussions. The officials have shunned Judith and the authorities have barred her from investigations. Her only hope lies in befriending the exotic Minou Hobday (Joan Chen), the wife of a high ranking diplomat and a woman with connections. Co-starring Jack Thompson and Art Malik. From the original novel “Turtle Beach” by Blanche d’Alpuget.

results.title: Turning
results.brief_description: Looks at Anatolia and its part in the evolution of Caucasian civilization, in particular that of modern Middle Eastern religious thought. The Dervishes and their ancient dance rituals are studied in some detail.

results.title: Kerry
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Kerry is a fifteen year old girl who leaves home and lives with her boyfriend. She becomes pregnant and returns to her family. The film considers some of the effects that the pregnancy and the decision to keep the baby have on Kerry’s relationship with her family and her boyfriend.

results.title: Wendy
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Wendy has her pregnancy terminated by abortion and the film reveals some of her reactions, her boyfriend’s and those of her mother to this situation. The film concludes with Wendy emphasising the importance of communications in teenage relationships. Cinemaphotography by Dean Semler. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Jenny
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
A film focusing on a teenage girl in a homosexual relationship. Jenny discusses her perception of the ‘gay’ scene, her relationship and how she feels other people perceive her life-style.

results.title: Brad
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Brad identifies himself as a homosexual. The film examines his reactions to homosexuality and the importance of relationships with other males. His mother expresses her feelings about Brad’s sexuality; he is shown in his employment and enjoying himself socially.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from East Gippsland
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: The towns of Swifts Creek, Omeo, Lakes Entrance, Orbost, Marlo and Cape Conran are quite distinct from each other but all make up the region of East Gippsland, which lies in the south-east of Victoria. In ‘ACMI in the regions: stories from East Gippsland’, locals from each town are interviewed about their lives, their community and what makes living in these towns so special.
results.title_for_label: ACMI in the regions: Stories from East Gippsland
